info.name: HRMS Leave Management API
info.description:
> 

This project follows a **simulated microservices architecture** with **multi-tenant support**.  
Each core module (Auth, Organization, Employee, Policy, and Leave) is designed as an **independent Django app**, communicating internally like separate microservices within a **modular monolithic structure**.  
Multi-tenancy is achieved using **foreign key relationships to the Organization model**, ensuring that all data (users, employees, policies, and leaves) is securely scoped to each organization while maintaining logical separation between tenants.

request.description:
### Super Admin Registration

Used to create the main Super Admin account for the system.

**Access:** Public (only for initial setup)  
**Request Body Example:**  
{  
"email": "[admin@example.com](https://mailto:admin@example.com)",  
"username": "superadmin",  
"password": "Admin@123",  
"role": "SUPERADMIN"  
}

**Response:** 201 Created – Returns the SuperAdmin user details.

response.name: Register - Create  Super_admin(demo user)
response.body:
{
    "id": 12,
    "email": "admin1234@example.com",
    "username": "superadmin1234",
    "role": "SUPERADMIN",
    "organization": null
}

request.description:
### Super Admin Login

Authenticates a Super Admin and returns `access` and `refresh` tokens.

**Access:** Public  
**Use:** Copy the `access` token → Add it to Authorization Header as:  
Authorization: Bearer {{access_token}}

response.name: Login as Super_admin - get tokens

header.description: JWT acces token of Super_admin(only super admin can create hr

request.description:
### HR Registration

Creates a new HR user under a selected organization.

**Access:** SuperAdmin only  
**Request Example:**  
{  
"email": "[hr@example.com](https://mailto:hr@example.com)",  
"username": "hr_user",  
"password": "Hr@123",  
"organization": "{{org_id}}"  
}

response.name: Register-HR User

    "role": "HR",
    "organization": "18f2a068-1d80-4657-8e7c-05d57326ebfd"
}

**Access:** Public

request.description:
### Employee Registration

Creates a new Employee user account linked to an organization.

**Access:** HR or Super Admin only  
**Required Fields:**

- email
    
- username
    
- password
    
- organization (auto from HR’s org)

    "role": "EMPLOYEE",
    "organization": "18f2a068-1d80-4657-8e7c-05d57326ebfd"
}

**Access:** Public  
Use token for further Employee API calls.

request.description:
Create a new organization.

Only **Super Admin** users can perform this action.

Requires fields like **organization name**, **code**, and **time zone**.

**Authorization:** Bearer Token (Super Admin)  
**Method:** `POST`  
**Endpoint:** `/api/organization/`

request.description:
Retrieve a list of all organizations.

- **Super Admin**: Can view all organizations.
    
- **HR/Employee**: Can view only their own organization.
    

**Authorization:** Bearer Token  
**Method:** `GET`  
**Endpoint:** `/api/organization/`

EndFragment

header.description: JWT acces token of Super_admin or HR can Create employees

request.description:
Creates a new Employee record linked to an existing user and organization.  
  
Only **SuperAdmin** or **HR** can create an employee.  
  
Each employee must already have a corresponding `User` (registered via the auth module).

**Request Body Example:**

```
{
  "user": "{{user_id}}",
  "organization": "{{org_id}}",
  "employee_code": "EMP001",
  "department": "Engineering",
  "designation": "Software Engineer",
  "date_of_joining": "2024-06-10",
  "is_active": true
}

 ```

**Notes:**

- `user` and `organization` should use environment variables like `{{user_id}}` and `{{org_id}}`.
    
- Duplicate `employee_code` is not allowed.

response.name: Link User  in employee app

header.description: JWT acces token of Super_admin(only super admin can create hr

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
Retrieves details of a specific employee using their UUID.  
  
Access depends on role:

- **SuperAdmin** → can access any employee.
    
- **HR** → can access employees within their organization.
    
- **Employee** → can access their own record only.
    

**Path Parameter Example:**  
`/employee/{{employee_id}}/`

response.name: GET Specific Employee details

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
Deletes an employee record by UUID.  
  
Only **SuperAdmin** can perform this operation.

**Notes:**

- Once deleted, the employee record cannot be recovered.
    
- Associated leaves or policies will remain linked to history (if applicable).

header.description: JWT acces token of Super_admin or HR can Create employees

body.raw:
{
    "organization": "{{org_id}}",
    "name": "Annual  new Leave",
    "policy_type": "ANNUAL",
    "description": "Annual leave policy for all employees",
    "max_days_per_year": 20,
    "carry_forward_days": 5,
    "requires_document": false,
    "max_days_without_doc": 3,
    "notice_period_days": 2,
    "allow_encashment": true,
    "encashment_limit": 10,
    "is_active": true
}

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
Creates a new leave policy for an organization.  
  
Only **SUPERADMIN** or **HR** users can create a policy.  
  
Required fields:

- `organization` – UUID of the organization (environment variable: `{{org_id}}`)
    
- `name` – Name of the policy (e.g. "Annual Leave")
    
- `policy_type` – Type of policy (`ANNUAL`, `SICK`, `CASUAL`, `UNPAID`)
    
- `max_days_per_year` – Maximum leave days allowed per year
    
- `carry_forward_days` – Days that can be carried forward to next year
    
- `requires_document` – Whether a document is required
    
- `max_days_without_doc` – Days allowed without document
    
- `notice_period_days` – Minimum notice required before applying leave
    
- `allow_encashment` – Whether leave encashment is allowed
    
- `encashment_limit` – Maximum days allowed for encashment

response.name: Create new Policies

request.description:
Returns the change history of a specific policy.  
  
Each version contains:

- Policy name and type
    
- Version number
    
- What fields changed (`changed_data`)
    
- Who made the change (`changed_by`)
    
- When it was changed (`changed_at`)  
      
    Accessible by SUPERADMIN, HR, and employees (read-only).

header.description: JWT acces token of Super_admin or HR can Create employees

request.description:
Employee applies for a leave request under a specific policy.  
Only logged-in employees can apply.

Required Fields:

- policy – UUID of the leave policy ({{policy_id}})
    
- start_date – Leave start date
    
- end_date – Leave end date
    
- reason – Reason for leave (e.g., "Family Trip")
    
- attachment – Optional document upload (nullable)
    

Notes:

- The system automatically links the logged-in employee’s profile and organization.
    
- Status defaults to "Pending" until reviewed by HR.
    
- For leave approval there are specific condition it should be satisfy like leave should not be greater than three days if it's greater than three days you should attach any supporting document like that ...there are around 12 to 15 conditions then only leave will apply

response.name: Employee Applies for Leave

header.description: JWT acces token of Super_admin or HR can Create employees

request.description:
Used by HR to take action on an employee’s leave request.

Fields:

- action – One of: APPROVE, REJECT, or CANCEL
    
- comments – Optional reason for action
    

Notes:

- Only HR users of the same organization can perform this action.
    
- Once a leave is approved or rejected, it cannot be edited by the employee.

response.name: HR Reviews the Leave Request

request.description:
Allows HR to reject a specific leave request.  
Marks the request as "Rejected" with optional comments.

Notes:  
You can also handle rejection using the /action/ endpoint  
by passing "action": "REJECT" if you prefer a single endpoint for all actions.

request.description:
Fetches all leave requests of the currently logged-in user.

Behavior:

- If logged in as Employee → Shows their own leave requests.
    
- If logged in as HR → Shows leave requests submitted by employees in their organization.
    
- Supports filtering and pagination if configured.
